profile_positions.description: Appointed by the Bishop of Haarlem as per Jan 1st, 2019, to manage the 5 parishes Nes a/d Amstel, Kudelstaart, De Kwakel, Aalsmeer and Uithoorn. The objective of the 7-person team is primarily of an economic nature. In this function I have looked carefully at the Balance Sheet and the Income Statement of our own parish, trying to make a number of improvements on our levels of cost, expenses and also our benefits. However, these are of a minor nature compared to the problem that has been building up in our Balance Sheet for the past decade.
profile_positions.title: Church Administrator

profile_positions.description: The Client Council defends the interests of the inhabitants of Het Hoge Heem and meets on a regular basis with its director. The inhabitants of the institution suffer from geriatric problems, which can be of a physical nature (appartments) or they can be of a mental nature (locked ward). In the latter case, the inhabitants need to be represented by family members or caregivers.
profile_positions.title: Client Council member

profile_positions.description: Towards the end of 2007 I wanted to move from IT to BC. I did various short jobs in Business Controls to acquire and build my skills. Where I had to learn to delegate as many tasks as possible in my years as Manager of Computing and CIO representative for Benelux, I now had to possess the skills to perform all tasks fully by myself. I worked for a number of months in Payroll, in Procurement (first Corporate Audit) and in Application Management Services (second Corporate Audit). In April 2010 I became a member of the GBS Compliance Team, in charge of Data Security and Privacy. I participated in 2 Business Controls Reviews held in Antwerp in the summer of 2011, where I acted as the coördinator, responsible for receiving Requests For Information, chasing their answering, timely posting to the auditors and ad hoc status reporting. Currently I am responsible for the Risk Assessment process covering some 300 active AMS and Consulting projects at each point in time. In addition I ensure that the circa 1500 GBS Benelux employees get their annual DS&P certification.
profile_positions.title: Business Controls & Compliance

profile_positions.description: In the summer of 2005 I acquired the title of CIO representative and became responsible for the entire Benelux. In my area are in total more than 10,000 end-users. Main goals were to achieve a 10% cost take out year on year and to have an ICT satisfaction score of 80% satisfied users. In the October 2007 satisfaction survey the Benelux reached this target of 80% (where the world wide score was 74% and the European score was 78%). Satisfaction contributors were the creation of a one stop shop for end user support (Olympus) and effective communication (newsletter, website, task id). In 2005/2006 I ran a project to replace company supplied home lines by a tax free allowance for employees. This project saved over 330,000 euros of one time charges and 500,000 euros of structural costs, while at the same time opening the home working programme for more employees. It was one of the main contributors of the 10% cost take out to be made annually.
profile_positions.title: Chief Information Officer

profile_positions.description: Per January 1st 2002 I took the role of Manager of Computing, on top of the CDM role, on me. I am receiving functional guidance from the Regional IGA manager in the UK. In this function I am responsible for the ICT budget, maintaining close contact with the Business Units via 20 FIMs (Functional Implementation Managers). Under my direct guidance 6 team members are carrying out analyses, writing to end-users, publishing articles on our own website, and giving education and support to end-users. My virtual organization includes other groups such as Order Desk, Voice Group, Service Management, Repair Coordinator, Desk Side Support, and Network Group. In this period I ran several cost saving initiatives such as the migration of 3,000 home connections from dial in to ADSL saving 335,000 euros annually, reducing the voice cost on home lines through a mailing campaign, and taking another approach in laptop repairs.
profile_positions.title: Manager of Computing

profile_positions.description: The Country Deployment Manager safeguards the interests of the 6,800 end users in The Netherlands. His manager locally is the Manager of Computing, who reports directly to the Director of IBM Global Services. The CDM functionally reports to the Manager of IGA, region North, who resides in the UK. All changes in the IT infrastructure are passed to the CDM, who takes care of the project oriented roll-out of these changes. The CDM is responsible for the end user satisfaction and escalates complaints of end users. On top of that, the CDM plays an important role in the registration, management and deployment of work stations. The CDM has regular contact with Country Service Management, Country Infrastructure Implementation, the Central Helpdesk, and Communications. In this period I carried out the migration of all end users to a new version of Lotus Notes, and I reduced the usage of SNA with 450,000 euros of annual savings.
profile_positions.title: Country Deployment Manager

profile_positions.description: Goal of this project was to activate Usage Based Charging for commercial customers in order to provide insight in the profitability of Strategic Outsourcing contracts to Project Executives and others. In this project my tasks were (a) to create a Blue Print, a general architecture via which UBC could be activated in successive European countries; (b) to prepare table values with which a pilot of around 20 selected SO-customers in Germany could kick-off in the year 2000. UBC concerns the gathering of MVS and VM CPU and DASD usage data, the calculation of the amounts to be charged, and the generation of the required journal entries. During this project I delivered as project information: a PIR (Project Identification Report), the Blueprint (the architec-ture) and a PDR (Project Definition Report). The pilot to test this architecture in Germany has started in 2000 according to plan.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
This function consisted of building up a team (growing at a rate of 1 or 2 persons per month) of both experienced and inexperienced IT specialists. Via this team I was in charge of creating a large number of Lotus Notes applications via the principles of Rapid Application Development. This team was soon regarded as a “skills engine” for new recruits, in which coaching and on the job training received high attention. In addition I spent considerable effort on the acquisition of new projects and the offering of solutions to my customers, with a total development cycle in the range of 2 to 4 months. The most important applications of this period are: SCM Workbench, Merit Workbench, Sales Incentive Plan, Profits II,  Assign database, Vacation database.	

1998: Sales Incentive Plan
For this project I did the requirements analysis, prototyping, education and roll-out of a Lotus Notes application for the commission to be paid to Sales Representatives. It had to be delivered at the end of the second quarter, although the requirements were not yet stable. Information protection, budget controls and privacy considerations were key in this project.

1997: Merit Workbench For this project I did the requirements analysis, prototyping, education and roll-out of a Lotus Notes application to determine salary increases, bonuses and promotions for 750 employees. This system has interfaces with personnel data (incoming) and payroll (outbound). It had strict controls and a full audit trail. The application was in production within 4 calendar months. It was developed as a one-man-project at cost of only 400 net man hours.

1996 - 1997: Human Resource Manager's Workbench
In this project I did the requirements analysis, prototyping and pilot implementation of a Lotus Notes database queried by people managers using their laptops. I designed and coded the agents via which this LN database was loaded daily with extract files from HR, labour claim, assignment office and the directory.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader Rapid Application Development

profile_positions.description: Project: Requirements analysis, design and implementation of a data warehouse with financial information stored on a host computer (MVS/DB2) and accessed by users in accounting, planning and measurements, who perform multi-dimensional analyses on their workstations. I was the team lead in this project and promoted the use of the data warehouse in the major European countries.
profile_positions.title: Financial Data Warehouse Architect

profile_positions.description: Application: accounts receivable. For an existing system with over 400,000 lines of code, a solution had to be designed to allow it to work with multiple currencies, as required by countries in Latin America and Asia. My design for this solution covered 170 pages, which I communicated to and had reviewed by user representatives in 4 phases.
profile_positions.title: Designer Multi Currency Solution
